modules.description: Implements cryptographic primitives for hashing and message authentication. It provides SHA-256, RIPEMD-160, and HMAC-SHA512 operations on Cstruct.t data. Used for generating cryptographic digests and authenticated hashes in blockchain and key derivation workflows.

This module implements BIP32 hierarchical deterministic key derivation for cryptographic keys, supporting operations to generate key pairs from entropy, derive child keys using 32-bit integer indices, and convert between key representations and byte sequences. It works with `Cstruct.t` for binary data input/output and `Secp256k1.Key.secret` and `Secp256k1.Key.public` types for cryptographic keys, encapsulated in a `Bip32.t` structure. Concrete use cases include wallet key management in blockchain applications, deriving extended keys for transactions, and serializing/deserializing keys for storage or transmission.

This module implements BIP32 hierarchical deterministic key derivation for cryptographic wallets. It provides functions to generate keys from entropy, derive child keys using 32-bit indices, and convert between key types and byte representations. Operations include parsing, formatting, and converting secret and public keys to and from Cstruct buffers.

This module implements hierarchical deterministic key derivation according to BIP32, enabling the generation and management of cryptographic keys for blockchain applications. It supports key derivation from entropy, child key derivation using 32-bit indices, and serialization/deserialization of keys to and from byte sequences using `Cstruct.t`. The module integrates cryptographic operations such as SHA-256, HMAC-SHA512, and RIPEMD-160 for hashing and authentication, which are essential for deriving and securing keys in wallet systems. Users can generate extended key pairs, derive keys along BIP44 paths, and securely serialize keys for offline storage or transaction signing.
